page.title: 14The Gondola, Coniston Water
page.content: {SPECIFICATIONS OF GONDOLA:} * Built by Jones & Quiggan (Liverpool) in 1859 for the Furness Railway Co. * The engine is steam-driven (coal-fired) with a working pressure of 68kg. Built by W. Bertram & Sons Ltd., South Shields; dated 5.3.1980. * The vessel weighs 25 tonnes. * The Gondola may carry a maximum of 86 passengers and 3 crew. * On her prow she carries the original twin-tailed serpent and carved boards bearing the Duke of Devonshire's armorial. * From April to November the Gondola operates 4 sailings per day, rising to 5 sailings in the summer. * The passenger accomodation on the vessel is divided into two saloons. The first class saloon is fitted out with velvet upholstery, the second class with leather.
